definition: to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: Inside the gate is the Xiangtang Hall, where family members commemorate the ancestors or hold meetings.
sentences.chinese: 穿過門廳就是“享堂”，是族人祭祖議事的地方。

sentences.english: The culture for King Zhou to worship is mainly characteristic of offering sacrifices to ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 周王祭禮文化獨特特徵是以祭祖爲主。

sentences.english: Since women cannot perform the duties of ancestor worship, girl children are often murdered by their parents.
sentences.chinese: 女人不能履行祭祖的職責，所以女嬰常常被父母弄死。

sentences.english: I will feign to offer a sacrifice and leave with my wife.
This is the fundamental difference between ancestor worship activity and other sacrifice activities.
sentences.chinese: 這一點，是祭祖與其他祭祀活動有根本不同的地方。

sentences.english: The first is a ceremony to worship ancestors, which means not to forget ancestors. Ancestors are worshipped at the home all around the year.
sentences.chinese: 第一個就是祭祖的儀式，不忘記祖先的意思。

sentences.english: The sweet green rice ball is used to worship ancestors as well as to serve the relatives and friends.
sentences.chinese: 青團是清明祭祖的食品之一，也用來饋贈或款待親友。

sentences.english: The first is a ceremony to worship ancestors, which means not to forget ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 第一個就是祭祖的儀式，不忘記祖先的意思。

sentences.english: The mid-July ancestor worship is one of the traditional Chinese customs.
sentences.chinese: 中元祭祖是中國民間的傳統習俗之一。

sentences.english: In addition, Academy educated students by sacrificing previous sagas.
sentences.chinese: 此外，書院祭祖先聖先師加強對學生的教導。

sentences.english: As for Shanghai, green groups are very ancestor-worship clear offerings.
sentences.chinese: 對上海人而言，青團是清明祭祖時必不可少的供品。

definition: to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to pay careful attention to one's parents' funerary rites
to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
to sweep a grave (and pay one's respects to the dead person)
to offer sacrifices to the gods
to respect a deity/to pray to a God
